channel.title: My computer ip :(
channel.description: hi my computer ip keeps changing itself what do i doo? my friends cant run the server because everytime i log of the on my ip for my computer changes what do i do?

item.title: My computer ip :(
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:5, topic:430557”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=533236.msg3897861#msg3897861 date=1327469943]

Or use No-IP to link your computer to a name.
[/quote]Doesn’t your No-IP check for your local IP to DNS for? Or does it update?

The No-IP client automatically updates the address is different than the last address.

If you run the No-IP client, with hostname somesite.no-ip.org, on a computer with IP address 1.2.3.4, then all requests for “somesite.no-ip.org” will be sent to the computer running the client (IP 1.2.3.4).

Then if you run the client on computer 2.3.4.5, the No-IP client checks, sees that 2.3.4.5 isn’t the same as 1.2.3.4, and so it changes the address, so that all requests for “somesite.no-ip.org” will be redirected to 2.3.4.5[/quote]Oh. I get it. Thanks for the clarification.

Read full topic

item.title: My computer ip :(
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:4, topic:430557”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=533236.msg3897855#msg3897855 date=1327469881]
Or use No-IP to link your computer to a name.
[/quote]Doesn’t your No-IP check for your local IP to DNS for? Or does it update?[/quote]

The No-IP client automatically updates the address is different than the last address.

If you run the No-IP client, with hostname somesite.no-ip.org, on a computer with IP address 1.2.3.4, then all requests for “somesite.no-ip.org” will be sent to the computer running the client (IP 1.2.3.4).

Then if you run the client on computer 2.3.4.5, the No-IP client checks, sees that 2.3.4.5 isn’t the same as 1.2.3.4, and so it changes the address, so that all requests for “somesite.no-ip.org” will be redirected to 2.3.4.5

Read full topic
